line_1: She sees whom lost with anguish she deplored;
line_2: Borne from the cavern, and to life restored,

line_1: I rouz'd the swains who yet deplor'd
line_2: I turn'd my sheep-hook to a sword,

line_1: The object dear — so long deplor'd —
line_2: "Him whom I call'd my bosom's lord!"

line_1: Alive; when dead, how much her loss deplor'd!
line_2: How charming all, how much she was ador'd

line_1: Or sadly gazing on that form deplored,
line_2: As one who late hath lost a friend adored,

line_1: And say, blot out my sin, confess'd, deplor'd,
line_2: Against thine image in thy saint, oh Lord!
